item.title: Gobblin Gobbles Prime Ministership
item.description: Big shakeup as UPP takes the highest office in divided post-Pavia First landscape. /T.U. Omasz In what came as a shock result to some, the UPP received a nearly immediate win in the first round of voting with 14 votes, leading to a 15 vote win in the second round. AMP and Renew were left trailing behind with 5 and 6 votes respectively in the first round and 11 votes for Renew in the second round.

item.title: Debris Crisis Continues On
item.description: For another week in a row, the global debris crisis has also hit Pavia’s economy and consumers, despite high demand there are hardly any suppliers, why is that? The geopolitical situation in recent months, above all the tense situation at the North Pole and on the north-west world border caused by the ‘wet bandits’, has paralysed the international economy. Various companies have turned to government contracts and neglected the public market to protect the local nations.

item.title: Prime Minister Resigns
item.description: Prime Minister Cissonius announcing his resignation to the public and press earlier today. /C. EEPION In a surprising turn of events, Cissonius (Pavia First) has today announced his immediate resignation from the post of Prime Minister, a development that has surprised many political pundits and the reasoning is nothing short of curious. In an event announced to the press, former Prime Minister Cissonius announced that he had dreamt last night about Braemari sheep and their ‘soft wool’ and ‘reassuring presence’.

item.title: Mayor Ahri Announces Public Health Initiative
item.description: The first public Pumpkin Pie Station in Pavia City /AHRIMANNE Away from the trench warfare of national politics, the newly elected mayor of Pavia, Ahrimanne, has launched a city-wide initiative to combat ‘hunger, malnutrition and widespread vitamin deficiencies’. This evening, the first pumpkin pie station of the new campaign was opened without a major press conference at the junction of MG Square and the west entrance to the town hall.

item.title: PM Betrayal Plunges Country Into Chaos
item.description: Premier Minister Cissonius in his cabinet’s offices. /CHRISTINA ONNIUS (HRM GOVERNMENT) After the cabinet under Prime Minister Cissonius (Pavia First) launched tax and immigration reforms at the beginning of the week, Cissonius has now cancelled the governing coalition with Renew. Several cabinet members were denied access to the government chambers in the town hall without warning. At an impromptu press conference yesterday evening, Cissonius gave a speech about the great achievements his Pavia First government had made so far.

item.title: How To Behave During A Riot
item.description: Due to the ongoing protests and public outbreaks of violence, caution is advised on the streets and squares of Pavia. If you see hundreds of coastguards moving towards you, get out of the way or walk in the opposite direction. Do not start running in order to avoid stampedes and the risk of being arrested. If you see protesters damaging or stealing property, move away from the scene immediately. Otherwise you risk reprisals from coastguard troops or arrest.

item.title: Sixteen Hospitalised In Latest Street Unrests
item.description: A protester in central Pavia City. Experts fear similar demonstrations in the duchies if public demands are not met. /PATRICK ÀGGF Sixteen Pavians, of whom five currently in critical condition, were admitted to the Pavian Hospital of the Well-Heeled last night as a result of a violent confrontation among widespread unrest in the city. The incident, reportedly involving a scarecrow in the likeness of the Prime Minister, took place around midnight near the docks.

item.title: Fanatical Tax and Immigration Reform Passed Tonight
item.description: Prime Minister Cissonius announcing the controversial decrees. /CHRISTINA ONNIUS (HRM GOVERNMENT) In an unexpected announcement, Prime Minister Cissonius has launched two new decrees. They are intended to fill the state coffers and bring more immigrants into the city, but many see this political shift by Pavia First as opportunistic and extremely dangerous. Major entrepreneurs, philanthropists and members of the opposition reacted with shock. Only a few minutes after the announcement, Renew - a coalition partner in the current cabinet - published a press release.

item.title: Mayoral Election Signals Major Concerns
item.description: Yesterday’s inauguration of Ahri as the first Mayor of Pavia, accompanied by Lady Sandfalls, PM Cissonius and Emperor Seekinq. /CHRISTINA ONNIUS (HRM GOVERNMENT) As Pavia’s first mayoral election has concluded, the focus shifts to understanding the political ramifications. The historical election follows Pavia’s radical transformation roughly two months ago, when the Reform Act of June 2024 abandoned the nation’s traditional aristocratic protocols and saw the installation of a democratically elected Prime Minister.

item.title: Pudding Lane Violence Continues
item.description: While the first mayoral election was held this weekend, the violence in Pudding Lane continued unabated. Once again, Windermerian harbour workers and immigrant newfriends clashed, causing chaos and havoc on the streets for hours. Law and order was only restored after a coastguard dog unit mobilised and separated the two camps. After both Gobblin, the Duke of Windermere, announced a cut in public funding for the local shipbuilders’ guild and the coastguard cancelled a long-term contract for the procurement of dozens of new cannon ships, the situation in lower Windermere had been escalating for weeks.

item.title: Ahrimanne Secures Rough Win
item.description: Mayor Ahri celebrating in front of a crowd of supporters his close victory. /PATRICK ÀGGF A few minutes ago, the Office of the State Tabulator announced the results of the first election for mayor of Pavia. As expected by the polls, Ahri was able to acclaim victory, but with a much smaller majority than hoped for. As the campaign team around Ahrimanne had expected a stronger majority, this election result came as a big surprise to them.

item.title: Ahri Sets Sights on Triumph Amid Cedar’s Growing Doubts
item.description: Pavians from all social classes and demographic background are still in line at the voting stations. /C. EEPION While the first mayoral election for the city of Pavia is still ongoing, Pavia Daily sought insights from the candidates on their chances and the impact of the recent debate. Ahri, who secured 77% of the post-debate vote, expressed cautious optimism. While pleased with the debate’s outcome, Ahri noted that the low viewership, due to its timing and restricted channel access, might limit its influence on the broader electorate.

item.title: Ahrimanne Stomps CedarValiant in Pre-Election debate
item.description: The two candidates, Ahrimmane and CedarValiant (f.l.t.r) fought a fierce battle in yesterday’s debate. /CHRISTINA ONNIUS (HRM GOVERNMENT) In a heated debate that captured the attention of Pavia’s residents, mayoral candidates Ahrimanne and CedarValiant passionately presented their visions for the city’s future. Ahrimanne emerged as the clear favorite among viewers, with post-debate polls indicating that over 77% would support him in the upcoming election. The debate, broadcast live across the city, underscored the distinct differences in their approaches, with Ahrimanne’s proposals resonating more profoundly with the electorate.

item.title: Exchange Fiasco Continues As Market Cannot Keep Up
item.description: Pavia is facing a severe floating exchange crisis affecting its key markets. The local currency’s erratic fluctuations have disrupted the sand, copper, and clay exchanges, critical to industries like construction and manufacturing. These markets are experiencing either stock shortages or soaring demand, leading to significant price instability. Service providers struggle to adjust prices swiftly enough to match the dynamic market conditions, exacerbating supply disruptions and cost inflation. Analysts attribute the crisis to a mix of global supply chain issues and local policy decisions, raising concerns about long-term economic stability.

item.title: Squirrel Infestation Haunts BOA’s Newest Prestige Project
item.description: The animals are occupying the entire greenhouse. /T. RALDREK The new Vetranian Botanical Gardens have suffered a massive blow: a massive infestation of squirrels. After weeks of capital expenditures to improve the botanical gardens, construction has yielded us with this absolute disaster to the public purse. Not only that, weeks of construction on these public grounds have resulted in numerous injuries to both visitors and contractors, overextended budgets, and a whole lot of squirrels.
